newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: PRESS DIGEST - Philippine newspapers - Jan 20.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Philippine newspapers - Jan 20.

text.p: These are the leading stories in Manila newspapers on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Zamboanga del Norte congressman Romeo Jalosjos says a lawyer-friend tipped off the police on his whereabouts (PHILIPPINE STAR)
- President Fidel Ramos orders the country's law enforcers to spare no one in their search for the those who harboured congressman Romeo Jalosjos (MANILA TIMES)
- Congress resumes its regular session after a four-week Christmas recess with its bicameral conference committee tackling the national budget, which is still in deadlock. (MANILA BULLETIN)
- The presidential palace says the proposed citizen's identification card scheme will not require government funding as claimed by opposition members of the Senate (MANILA STANDARD)
- The regional tripartite wages and productivity board is closing in on a 20 peso increase in the 165 peso minimum wage in Metro Manila (BUSINESS DAILY)
- The National Power Corp says it is set to revise its fuel cost adjustment formula by March to be able to lower power rates by six to nine centavos per kilowatthour (MANILA BULLETIN)
- The suspension of investigations of insider trading in the Philippine Stock Exchange has resulted in wild plays in speculative and penny stocks. (BUSINESSWORLD)
